#Text=Show Your Pride As a Dog Owner
#Text=You love your dog and want to show your pride as a pet owner .
#Text=You can do this by setting a good example for other pet owners through respectful behavior , like cleaning up after your dog and keeping your dog on a leash .
#Text=You can also show your pride as a dog owner by entering your dog in competitive events .
#Text=Talent and costumes contests are great examples !
#Text=You can also show your pride as a dog owner by putting your dog to work .
#Text=Training your pooch as a rescue or therapy dog is a great way to show off your pride while helping others .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Demonstrating Pride through Actions
#Text=Clean up after your dog .
#Text=One of the best ways to demonstrate your pride through action is to set a good example for others .
#Text=Make sure you always leave the house with the supplies you need to clean up after your pup .
#Text=Never leave your doggy ’s doo unattended .
#Text=After your dog does their business , clean it up and throw it away in a proper trash receptacle .
#Text=Always keep your dog on a leash .
#Text=When you ’re out for a walk with your dog , you can set a good example and show your pride as a pet owner by keeping your dog properly leashed .
#Text=In most places , your dog is required to be on a leash , except in places where dogs can safely be off leash such as dog parks .
#Text=Respect your neighbors .
#Text=Setting a good example as a dog owner means respecting those who live and work near you .
#Text=This includes keeping your dog on your property , not letting your dog wander around the neighborhood , and preventing your dog from barking incessantly or excessively .
#Text=Showing off Your Dog ’s Talents
#Text=Enter your dog in a costume contest .
#Text=A great way to be a proud dog owner is to enter your pooch in a costume contest .
#Text=While Halloween is a common time for canine costume contests , you can also find them at other community celebrations throughout the year .
#Text=Strive for a costume that is comfortable , yet clever .
#Text=Check out the festivities for local celebrations like independence day or other holidays , which are also popular times for dog costume contests .
#Text=Consider a dog race .
#Text=Is your dog quick on their paws ?
#Text=If so , you can show your pride as a dog owner by entering them in a local race .
#Text=Different communities have different options , often reflecting the climate and culture of the place where you live .
#Text=Check with your local chamber of commerce or community board for events near you .
#Text=Try a talent contest .
#Text=Does your dog have a special talent ?
#Text=Some dogs can howl along to a song , while others are great at balancing balls on their noses .
#Text=Whatever your dog ’s talent , you can show be a proud dog owner by entering them in a contest .
#Text=Contact your local chamber of commerce , tourism board , or humane society to inquire about events going on near you .
#Text=Putting Your Pooch to Work
#Text=Consider search and rescue training .
#Text=Dogs can do amazing things like locating lost children , following a missing Alzheimer ’s patient ’s path from a nursing home , and assisting law enforcement officers at crime scenes .
#Text=If your dog has a good nose , consider showing your pride as a dog owner by training them as a search and rescue dog .
#Text=You can find out about opportunities for search and rescue training by contacting your local search and rescue or law enforcement organization .
#Text=Certify your dog as a therapy dog .
#Text=Dogs who are certified as therapy dogs can bring joy and healing to a wide variety of people struggling with a vast array of issues or situations .
#Text=Therapy dogs can help children , the elderly , and those fighting mental or physical illness .
#Text=Consider getting your dog certified as a therapy dog if you want to show your pride by helping others .
#Text=Contact the American Kennel Club to find out how you can certify your pooch as a therapy dog .
#Text=Volunteer with your dog .
#Text=Whether it ’s a charity run with your pet , or taking them to a local nursing home to visit residents , there are many opportunities to show your pride as a pet owner through volunteerism .
#Text=Contact your local animal shelter or community volunteer board to seek out opportunities near you .

#Text=Some ideas for volunteering with your dog include donating pet blood , taking in a foster dog who needs to socialize with other pets , or visiting a local hospital that welcomes dog interactions with patients .
#Text=Quick Summary
